resources.string: We are MIT students participating in the IAP 2013 6.570 Android programming competition.
What is Requisitor? \n Requisitor is an app designed to help MIT students plan out and maintain their class schedules quickly and painlessly.

What can I do on Requisitor? \n You can use Requisitor to explore classes available across departments, check pre-reqs, plan class trajectories throughout your MIT career, taking into account pre-reqs and offering availability.

How do I use “Search Classes”? \n To find a class, limit your search by course, (partial) class number or keyword and scroll to browse. To input a class number or keyword to search, click on the button with a course number followed by a period (in position 1). A keyboard opens and the list updates with every input. To browse by course number or reset the list, click the button with just a course number (in position 2) and select a course from the drop down list. To see a class description, click on the class (as in position 3). To add a class, click on the class, select the term to add to from the drop down menu, and hit “Add Class”.
All chosen classes can be seen by semester in either the “List Classes” or the “Explore Classes” View.
How can I see which classes I have added? \n All chosen classes can be seen by semester in either the “List Classes” or the “Explore Classes” View.

How do I add classes that I have taken to the app? 
 You can do this in three ways: 
 Search: From the Search view, follow the directions above to add a class to any semester. 
 List: From the List view, press on the semester you want to add to and hold for a second or two. A context menu as shown below opens. From there, press “Add Another Class” and follow the Search directions. 
 Explore: As in the List view, find the semester you want to add to in Explore view and click and hold to open an identical context menu.
How do I remove classes that I have chosen? \n From either List or Explore view, click and hold the class you want to remove. From the context menu that opens, select “Remove” or “Replace”.

How can I see if I have the pre-reqs for a class I am trying to add? \n Enter the class into the semester you are considering it for in Explore view. If you are missing pre-reqs, the class will turn red upon selection and the missing pre-reqs will appear at the bottom of the screen.
